The human ear cannot hear all sounds of the universe. It only hears the frequency range of human speech that covers 250 Hz and 3000 Hz. It cannot hear the sounds below this frequency which are called infrasound and sounds of Ultrasonic which are above this and at a very high frequency. They can only be recorded with equipment that can perceive these high frequencies.

With the development of science and technology, the ultrasonic sounds of the universe from the atmosphere to the planets of the solar system which sound at a very high frequency have been recorded. The most interesting among them is the star which is named as Pulsar by the scientists, mentioned as the star of Tariq in the Qur'an and sworn by. Yes, this star, which is called Tariq, sounds just like the sound of the door being knocked by someone. The most interesting side of this is that the word of Tariq in Arabic language means the knocker on the door.

In fact, the word TARIQ stems from the root of the verb "tarq". Tarq means knocking strongly, slamming audibly. According to this, "tariq" basically means the one who beats strongly just like beating with a knocker and knocker on the door.

How could today's discovery of the sound of the star which is in the form of door knocking of named as Tariq meaning door knocker 1400 years ago be explained since there was no science and technology then?

Diving at about 120 feet in Alaska's Prince Willuam Sound, once I had a similar experience "I think" with nitrogen micro bubbles. Except for the weird part I cant resolve. I had redubdant systems and using nitrox mix and high intensity cave diver light. As I approached 120 with my dive buddy, I was looking down to where it went completelt dark below us. I suddenly heard 3 very evenly spaced "BOOMS" coming from the depth about 1.5 seconds apart. I could feel them ad if they were about to reverberatw in mt bones. I loojed to my patner to signal and it was immediately clear he did not hear thing. I then got hit again with three more even a bit louder and I then was overwhelmed with a sense that I was being warned away. I signaled to my buddy who again heard nothing which made me very much feel I was specifically being targeted ad I was about 15 feet deeper than he was and literally on the edge of the blackness. I signaled for us to ascend, thumbs up which must be obeyed when anyone in a group dive signals it but as I moved toward his position to begin ascending, I made a quick glance with my light behibd me again, and I swear I caught a glimpse of bluish reddish and I'll say orangy lights move quickly through the darkness below me and away from me. Now I was troubled and back on the boat after our multiple decompression stops, he had heard nor seen anything. I never returned to diving there again. I asked every diver I knew and no one could say theyve had a similar experience. So..my determination was that nitrox micro bubbles had popped in my inner ear twice and then in my optic nerve, but the mystery is that the booms were so evenly spaced and that I felt the immense heavy bass of them in my body.
